translated: Homage to Ucchusma Jambhala.

translated: One should summon with Om Ah.

analyzed: rang gi snying gar aa yig yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su h'um yig yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: In the center of a moon maṇḍala in one's heart, which arises from the transformation of the letter A, is a letter Haṃ, which arises from the transformation of a letter Ja.

original: rdo rje rtse dgu pa de'i dbus su aindra go ba dang mnyam pa'i dza yig las /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse dgu pa de'i dbus su aindra go ba dang mnyam pa'i dza yig las /
translated: In the center of a nine-spoked vajra, which arises from the transformation of that, is a letter Ja, which is the same as sapphire.

analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i spyan 'dren pa'i sngags kyis /
translated: With the previously mentioned summoning mantra,

original: dzambha la'i mgon po rang gi snying gar gzhug ste /
analyzed: dzambha la'i mgon po rang gi snying gar gzhug ste /
translated: Jambhala, one should place Lord Jambhala in one's heart.

original: au tsushma byis pa'i gzugs rna ba ma phug pa /🔽sku mdog nag po skra gyen du brdzes pa /
analyzed: au tsushma byis pa'i gzugs rna ba ma phug pa / sku mdog nag po skra gyen du brdzes pa /
translated: Ucchusma has the form of a child, his ears are not pierced,🔽he is black, his hair is bristling,🔽he has a wrathful frown,

original: mi thung gi rnam pa khro gnyer can /🔽rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can /🔽phyag g-yon pas rin po che skyugs pa'i ne'u le 'dzin pa /
analyzed: mi thung gi rnam pa khro gnyer can / rin chen 'byung ldan gyi dbu rgyan can / phyag g-yon pas rin po che skyugs pa'i ne'u le 'dzin pa /
translated: he has a crown of Akṣobhya,🔽his left hand holds a mongoose vomiting jewels,

original: g-yas pas khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pas khrag gis bkang ba'i thod pa 'dzin pa /
translated: and his right hand holds a skull-cup filled with blood.

original: lho phyogs su mgo bstan pa'i gser gyi mdog can /
analyzed: lho phyogs su mgo bstan pa'i gser gyi mdog can /
translated: She is golden in color, facing south.

original: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa /
translated: She is adorned with various ornaments.

original: nor gter gan rgyal du bsgyel ba zhabs gnyis kyis mnan pa /
analyzed: nor gter gan rgyal du bsgyel ba zhabs gnyis kyis mnan pa /
translated: She is trampling on a treasure vase lying on its side with her two feet.

original: rin po che'i phreng ba skyugs pa'i bdag nyid las 'od zer gyi phring ba'i tshogs 'phro bar bsam /
analyzed: rin po che'i phreng ba skyugs pa'i bdag nyid las 'od zer gyi phring ba'i tshogs 'phro bar bsam /
translated: Think that from her, who has the nature of vomiting a precious garland, a collection of garlands of light rays emanates.

original: au tsushma'i phyag g-yas na aom yig las skyes pa'i gdu bu'o //
analyzed: au tsushma'i phyag g-yas na aom yig las skyes pa'i gdu bu'o //
translated: In Uṣṇīṣa’s right hand, from the syllable oṃ, is a bracelet.

original: bam yig las @79b skyes pa'i bum pa bzang po dang 'dra ba 'phro bzhin pa /
analyzed: bam yig las @79b skyes pa'i bum pa bzang po dang 'dra ba 'phro bzhin pa /
translated: From the syllable vaṃ, a good vase emanates.

original: lag pa'i dbus su dzam yig go //🔽mdzub mo la bha yig go //
analyzed: lag pa'i dbus su dzam yig go // mdzub mo la bha yig go //
translated: In the center of the hand is the syllable jaṃ.🔽On the index finger is the syllable bha.

original: gung mo la la yig go //🔽srin lag la dza yig go //
analyzed: gung mo la la yig go // srin lag la dza yig go //
translated: On the middle finger is the syllable la.🔽On the ring finger is the syllable ja.

original: mthe chung la len yig go //🔽mthe bo la dra yig go //
analyzed: mthe chung la len yig go // mthe bo la dra yig go //
translated: On the pinky finger is the syllable le.🔽On the thumb is the syllable dra.

original: mkhrig ma la ya yig go //
analyzed: mkhrig ma la ya yig go //
translated: On the wrist is the syllable ya.

original: de nas sv'a h'a'o //
analyzed: de nas sv'a h'a'o //
translated: After that, there is svāhā.

original: 'di ni sngags dgod pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sngags dgod pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the sequence of the mantra placement.

original: kha sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la chu skyor sbyin no //
analyzed: kha sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs la chu skyor sbyin no //
translated: Bless the water with the mantra and give it to the patient to drink.

original: aom dzlum sv'a h'a chu skyor sbyin pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom dzlum sv'a h'a chu skyor sbyin pa'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ jlum svāhā. The mantra for giving water to drink.

original: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aindra ni mu kham bhra ma ri sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ indranīmimukhī bhrāmarī svāhā.

original: lag pa nas kha dang / kha nas lag par de dben par sbyin no //
analyzed: lag pa nas kha dang / kha nas lag par de dben par sbyin no //
translated: From the hand to the mouth, and from the mouth to the hand, give it to him in private.

original: 'di ltar snying rjes sems can thams cad phongs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad gcod pa'i don du dzambha la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar snying rjes sems can thams cad phongs pa'i sdug bsngal thams cad gcod pa'i don du dzambha la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, out of compassion, for the sake of cutting off all the poverty of all sentient beings, one should meditate on Jambhala.

analyzed: au tsushma dzambha la zhes bya ba'i sgrub thabs rgyal po a'arya ma tis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The sādhana of Ucchuṣma Jambhala, composed by King Āryamati, is complete.
